  How Sign Language Works
  There are hundreds of sign languages, each with a rich vocabulary and grammar that exists independently of any spoken language. Learn about American Sign Language, the attempt to establish a universal sign language and other applications of 
sign language. 
 Also at HowStuffWorks
 

How Machinima
Works - In 2003,
production company Rooster Teeth helped expand audiences' awareness of
machinima when they unveiled "Red vs. Blue," a series of humorous
short films using the "Halo" game engine. Learn about machinima and how
to make your own machinima film.
 

How can
someone stay awake for 11 days? - Have you
ever pulled an all-nighter to study or finish a project? How about doing it 11
days in a row? A man in Cornwall,
 England,
actually went 11 consecutive days without a wink of sleep. Learn how he did it
and why you shouldn't attempt it.
 

Father's
Day Gifts: Camping Equipment for Dad - Father's
Day comes during the perfect season for camping, and what better way to show
your father how much you care than with a family camping trip? Check out our
camping-themed gift guide.Want more from HowStuffWorks? We've recently added 12 new 
RSS feeds. Besides the Daily Feature you can now enjoy feeds from Entertainment, Health, Auto, Home and Garden, Science and more. 
   
This Week's Video
 

How Karate Works - Karate is not only about strength and speed -- the technique
involves as much thought and focus as physical power. Watch this video from
HowStuffWorks to see how karate experts can break cinder blocks with their
feet.
